remarks.para: Class that represents the simplist single element when a type is involved in a signiture. Where for example a type can be represented simply as a base type a class, or a valuetype, the ElementTypeSignitureToken will contain the relevant details about it and provide a mechanism for resolving the type.
Where a type is described by more than a single element; that element will have its superflous detail described in the class.

member.name: ctor
member.param: The signiture where this token is defined.
The current offset in the signiture to read the token.

remarks.para: An ElementTypeSignitureToken details the element of a Type signiture. These elements are defined in section 23.1.16 in ECMA 335. Where a type can contain multiple ElementTypeSignitureTokens each building up to reveal more information about the type. This class will only ever provide a single item of detail.
Represents an element of a signiture that can be used to resolve back to a type, however the type it resolves back to can be one of many things; see ECMA 335 23.2.12.
A type can be represented by one or more tokens, hence this token derives from . However it will always have an which should allow any resolving to be perfomed more easily.
